column12: Wall cupboard with frame and sections - incorporates various compartments and has vertical gaps in which doors are mounted
column13: The wall cupboard comprises a frame (10) and sections mounted together. The shape and partitions are chosen as desired, with pivot mounted doors (25, 25') on the outsides. The shell of the cupboard has vertical spaces (12) between with adjacent Y shaped compartments (11). Along the U shaped sides (13) and bridge pieces (14) are fixed the cupboard sections (15, 17, 19). The spacer gaps (12) have a cavity (37) parallel to the U sides for mounting the doors (25, 25'), which are all mounted on the same front plane (23) in front of the free ends (24) of the U shaped sides (13).
column15: HIRCHE HERBERT PROF;;KLINK CLAUS-PETER;;GEHR RAINER;;KRISCH GEB BIERBRAUER KARIN
